definition: to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack
canvass for contributions/to recruit/to collect/to raise

sentences.english: With him went the noble levy and the private magnate armies.
sentences.chinese: 征募的贵族民团和权贵的私军与他同行。

sentences.english: And out of the $800 million that Obama raised, $700 million came from corporations and rich donors.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马征募的8亿竞选费，有7亿是来自公司和富人。

sentences.english: Certain age groups will be balloted at this time.
sentences.chinese: 这次对某年龄组的人征募。

sentences.english: We should check whether there is any questions about recruitment.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该检查对征募新兵是否有疑问。

sentences.english: Do you think Mitt or Sarah can raise that kind of money.
sentences.chinese: 你认为米特和萨拉佩林能征募到那些人的钱么？

sentences.english: If you can’t defend yourself, recruit an army.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能保护自己，那征募一个部队吧。

sentences.english: For the master to enlist your help, he surely thought highly of your abilities.
sentences.chinese: 让总领征募你的帮助，他一定认为你的能力很高。

sentences.english: The government will commandeer ships only in wartime.
sentences.chinese: 政府只会在战争期间征募船只。

sentences.english: The country's first act would be to recruit for the navy.
sentences.chinese: 国家的第一个行动是为海军征募新兵。

sentences.english: How do you recruit an army?

definition: to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
able-bodied man (capable of fighting in a war)
manpower resources (for military service)/sources of troops
to press into service/to impress/to commandeer
to fill a post/to act as
to enlist/to serve in the army
